info.name: [ACCOUNT] [INT STG] [14] - Delete Devices
info.description:
Works on both INT and STG environments.

The official documentation can be found here:

[https://intmt.private.nexicloud.it:4003/mt-services/issuing/orch/mfa/v1/swagger-ui.html#!/Device/deleteDevices](https://)

This collection should delete all user devices.

This collection depends on a number of INPUT fields:

- INPUT_mfaIdList (mandatory) – This parameter also handles email lists, with newline separator character
- INPUT_organization (mandatory)
- INPUT_profileType (mandatory)
    

The result of the collection is saved in the RESULT collection variable. An example of a result is the following

Usage:

- Reset collection variables;
- Set "INPUT_" prefixed parameters as your needs;
- Run the collection.
    

E.g.:

``` json
[
  {
    "userEmail": "insta.f@yopmail.com",
    "isSuccessfull": "true",
    "message": "Operation completed"
  }
]

 ```

Linked to the collection are also available a few response examples from deleteDevices in the cases of: success, failure and device not enrolled.

request.description: Lets subscribe card to one or more services.

response.name: Success

header.description: (Required) technical code of the application calling the service.
(Required) channel code of the request - [WEB, MOB, BAT]
(Required) user identifier of the request (username , userid , ...)
(Required) Partner belonging to the company. It describe a subset of NEXI customer related to the specified partner.
(Required) Random unique identification code of the request set by the client. Example UUID [8119c0ce-17f2-11e8-accf-0ed5f89f718b]
(Required) Random unique identification code identifying a single session of the client. Example JSESSIONID [b272023f-05ca-44cb-96cd-6d72c72d03f9]

response.name: Template response

header.description: (Required) technical code of the application calling the service.
(Required) channel code of the request - [WEB, MOB, BAT]
(Required) user identifier of the request (username , userid , ...)
(Required) Partner belonging to the company. It describe a subset of NEXI customer related to the specified partner.
(Required) Random unique identification code of the request set by the client. Example UUID [8119c0ce-17f2-11e8-accf-0ed5f89f718b]
(Required) Random unique identification code identifying a single session of the client. Example JSESSIONID [b272023f-05ca-44cb-96cd-6d72c72d03f9]

request.description:
```
generates and sets the Technical Token
```

Please, take a look to the swagger page for further details about the deleteDevice API:

[https://intmt.private.nexicloud.it:4003/mt-services/issuing/orch/mfa/v1/swagger-ui.html#/Device](https://intmt.private.nexicloud.it:4003/mt-services/issuing/orch/mfa/v1/swagger-ui.html#/Device)

This collection needs a few mandatory parameters in order to be succefully run:

INPUT_userEmailList (aka mfaId, e.g.: [insta.f@yopmail.com](mailto:insta.f@yopmail.com)) – This parameter also handles email lists, with newline separator character

INPUT_organization (e.g. NEXI)

INPUT_profileType (e.g. NEXI)

A list of available organization and profileType values are listed here: [https://icbpijira.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SER/pages/1587249247/TA+Test+Data](https://icbpijira.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SER/pages/1587249247/TA+Test+Data)

The result of the collection is saved in the RESULT collection variable. An example of a result is the following:

\[ { "userEmail": [insta.f@yopmail.com](mailto:insta.f@yopmail.com), "isSuccessfull": "true", "message": "Operation completed" } \]
